intro: Clematis tengchongensis, commonly known as the Tengchong clematis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the vine family, Ranunculaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
